levels/index.html/title.description: 1st level: title. Arca is the name of the character in the game. I'm not sure if it can or should be translated.

levels/index.html/hintsLeftRight.message: This is you! You can move left and right with the <kbd>←</kbd> and <kbd>→</kbd> keys.
levels/index.html/hintsLeftRight.description: 1st level: tell the player how to move about

levels/index.html/hintsTarget.message: Move over to this kitten to rescue it. You need to rescue all the kittens you find!

levels/index.html/hintsPortal.message: This is a portal. Walk in to see where it leads!

levels/editing-text.html/hintsJump.message: Try to jump over to this ledge

levels/editing-text.html/hintsEdit.message: Uh Oh! You need to make the ledge longer. Click 'Edit' or press the <kbd>E</kbd> key to change the level.

levels/editing-text.html/commentsMain.message:
This is the HTML source of this level. It describes the stuff shown on screen to the right. The code below is the ledge you are on. It starts with:

<p ...> and ends with </p>.

These <> bits are called tags. The bit that shows up on the page is the stuff between the tags. Try adding more writing to make the ledge longer.
levels/editing-text.html/commentsMain.description: 2nd level: html comments. Make sure you preserve the HTML structure!

levels/editing-text.html/commentsOther.message: This is the other ledge, on the far right. You can edit the code for this too!

levels/editing-text.html/htmlImALedge.description: 2nd level: level content. This must stay approximately the same length for the level to work

levels/editing-text.html/htmlImALedgeToo.description: 2nd level: level content. This must stay approximately the same length for the level to work

levels/creating-elements.html/hint.message: Hmmm... Looks as if we need more boxes. Try editing the level - use the <kbd>E</kbd> key or press the 'Edit' button.

levels/creating-elements.html/comment.message:
These are <div> tags. They represent the boxes. Try to create some of your own.

Remember to start with an opening <div> and a closing </div>, with some writing in between. Don't forget the /!
levels/creating-elements.html/comment.description: Space level: code comments. Make sure you preserve the HTML structure

levels/creating-elements.html/htmlBox1.description: Space level: content. The writing on the first box

levels/creating-elements.html/htmlBox2.description: Space level: content. The writing on the second box

levels/headings.html/commentsMain.message:
These are headings. The HTML headings are a very big family - they go all the way from <h1> (the most important heading) to <h6> (the least important heading). On a web page, you might have the page title in a <h1>, and a subtitle in a <h2>, for example.

The first two headings got you that far down into the cave - if you created more, you might be able to reach the bottom!

levels/headings.html/commentsGetStarted.message: Try adding a <h3> element to get started. Don't forget the </h3> at the end!
